ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How many hours of sleep does your child get on most nights?
Notes: 1 = 9-11 hours ; 2 = 8-9 hours ; 3 = 7-8 hours ; 4 = 5-7 hours ; 5 = Less than 5 hours

ElementDescription: How long after going to bed does your child usually fall asleep?
Notes: 1 = Less than 15 minutes ; 2 = 15-30 minutes ; 3 = 30-45 minutes ; 4 = 45-60 minutes ; 5 = More than 60 minutes

ElementDescription: The child goes to bed reluctantly
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child has difficulty getting to sleep at night
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child feels anxious or afraid when falling asleep
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child startles or jerks parts of the body while falling asleep
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child shows repetitive actions such as rocking or head banging while falling asleep
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child experiences vivid dream-like scenes while falling asleep
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child sweats excessively while falling asleep
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child wakes up more than twice per night
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: After waking up in the night, the child has difficulty falling asleep again
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child has frequent twitching or jerking of legs while asleep or often changes position during the night or kicks the covers off the bed
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child has difficulty breathing during the night
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child gasps for breaths or is unable to breathe during sleep
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child snores
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child sweats exessively during the night
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: You have observed the child sleepwalking
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: You have observed the child talking in his/her sleep
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child grinds his/her teeth during sleep
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child wakes from sleep screaming or confused so you cannot seem to get through to him/her, but has no memory of these events the next morning
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child has nightmares which he/she doesn't remember the next day
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child is unusuallly difficult to wake up in the morning
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child awakes in the morning feeling tired
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child feels unable to move when waking up in the morning
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child experiences daytime sleepiness
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: The child falls asleep suddenly in inappropriate situations
Notes: 1 = Never ; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) ; 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) ; 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week) ; 5 = Always (daily)

ElementDescription: Disorders of arousal
Sleep Breathing Disorders
Sleep Hyperhydrosis
Disorders of initiating and maintaining sleep
Disorders of excessive somnolence
Total score
Sleep-Wake Transition Disorders
Respondent - Other (text)
